news.headline: Microsoft upgraded, Harley-Davidson downgraded: Wall Street's top analyst calls
news.summary: Wells Fargo upgraded Glaukos (GKOS) to Overweight from Equal Weight with a price target of $120. Guggenheim upgraded Microsoft (MSFT) to Buy from Neutral.
news.article_text:
The most talked about and market moving research calls around Wall Street are now in one place. Here are today's research calls that investors need to know, as compiled by The Fly.



Top 5 Upgrades:



Wells Fargo upgraded Glaukos (GKOS) to Overweight from Equal Weight with a price target of $120, up from $92. Investors are focusing on iDose but the company's Epioxa represents a "significant underappreciated" growth driver, the firm tells investors in a research note.

news.headline: DAT execs in two forums discuss how it seeks to reshape the freight sector
news.summary: Roper Technologies has a large portfolio of technology-focused companies. But on its third quarter earnings call Thursday, it was DAT that took center stage. Roper management conceded the Convoy data stack DAT recently bought from Flexport is not profitable.
news.article_text: CHATTANOOGA–Roper Technologies has a large portfolio of technology-focused companies. But on its third quarter earnings call Thursday, it was DAT that took center stage in the presentation by Roper executives who were overwhelmingly positive about how the loadboard giant–now a lot more than that–is performing.Coincidentally, Bill Driegert, the executive vice president of the Convoy Platform at DAT, spoke in a fireside chat with FreightWaves and SONAR CEO Craig Fuller a day before the earnings re

news.headline: Roper Technologies (ROP): Evaluating Valuation After Earnings Beat, $3B Buyback, and Upbeat Growth Guidance
news.summary: Roper Technologies (ROP) just posted third-quarter earnings that beat market expectations and announced a new $3 billion share buyback plan. The company also reaffirmed strong guidance for revenue and profit growth through year-end. Despite some short-term weakness, total shareholder returns remain
news.article_text:
Roper Technologies (ROP) just posted third-quarter earnings that beat market expectations and announced a new $3 billion share buyback plan. The company also reaffirmed strong guidance for revenue and profit growth through year-end.

See our latest analysis for Roper Technologies.

Roper Technologies’ latest earnings beat and $3 billion buyback announcement have attracted fresh investor focus, but the company’s share price has drifted lower in recent months, with a 30-day return of -4.77% and ye

news.headline: Roper Q3 Earnings Top Estimates, Application Software Sales Up Y/Y
news.summary: Roper Technologies’ ROP third-quarter 2025 adjusted earnings of $5.14 per share surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate. The bottom line increased 11% on a year-over-year basis. Top line increased 14% year over year.
news.article_text:
Roper Technologies’ ROP third-quarter 2025 adjusted earnings of $5.14 per share surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $5.11. The bottom line increased 11% on a year-over-year basis.



Roper’s net revenues of $2.02 billion matched the consensus estimate. The top line increased 14% year over year. Organic revenues grew 6%, driven by solid momentum in the Application Software segment. Acquisitions boosted sales by 8%.

Roper’s Segmental Performance in Q3

Roper Technologies’ ROP third-quarter 2025 adjusted earnings of $5.14 per share surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $5.11. The bottom line increased 11% on a year-over-year basis.
